title: be able to provide file with a list of files to work with
body:
Initially came up while [discussing fix up to the failed datalad run "datalad save" command suggested INFO message](https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/3080#discussion_r240022955).  In the case of `--explicit` run it might be necessary to `datalad add` only the files specified in `{outputs}`, not all the files. Since such a list could be prohibitively long to present in the log message, I wondered if we should support some way to provide a list of files to consider from a file for e.g. `add` or `save` command.

So I wondered if we should may be handle `filelist://` prefix to point to a file with filenames.  But then I thought that may be we could generalize it even further?  e.g. if we support "list+" prefix to any url, so `list+file://./.git/COMMIT_ADDFILES` would the take that local file, `install list+http://someurl/listofurls.txt` would download the list of urls from the `http://someurl/listofurls.txt` and consider them as the `path` input to `install`.  Similar handling could be useful for `download-url` as well.

What do you think?
